title: How to Change the Default Font on Windows Notepad

steps.title: Open Notepad.
steps.content: Open Notepad. Click on the Start button to access the Start menu, and type "Notepad" to search for and open the program.

steps.title: Click on "Edit" and select the "Font" option from the dropdown menu.
steps.content: Click on "Edit" and select the "Font" option from the dropdown menu.

steps.title: Select the font family, style, and size you want to use.
steps.content: Select the font family, style, and size you want to use. This will change the font of the entire file. So any bolding or italicizing will be applied to the entire document. Notepad does not have the option of changing fonts of specific sections of text.

steps.title: Open Notepad.
steps.content: Open Notepad. There will be different ways to find and launch Notepad depending on which Windows version you have. Windows 10: Click the "Start" button in the bottom left-hand corner on your task bar. In the search box, type "Notepad", and in the list of results, click "Notepad". Windows 8: Go to your Start Screen and simply start typing "Notepad". A pop-up should appear on the left-hand side of the screen. Click "Notepad" to open it. Windows 7: Click the "Start" button in the bottom left-hand corner on your task bar. In the search box, type "Notepad", and in the list of results, click "Notepad". [1] X Research source Windows XP and Vista: Click the "Start" buttons in the bottom left-hand corner on your task bar. Mouseover "Programs", then "Accessories", and click "Notepad" to open.

steps.title: Click "Format".
steps.content: Click "Format". This is located on the menu bar and displays a drop down menu with two options.

steps.title: Select "Font" from the menu.
steps.content: Select "Font" from the menu. This will open a separate window that displays font options, font styles, and size.

steps.title: Select the font, style and size you want to use.
steps.content: Select the font, style and size you want to use. This will change the font of the entire file. So any bolding or italicizing will be applied to the entire document. Notepad does not have the option of changing fonts of specific sections of text.

steps.title: Press "OK" to save your settings.
steps.content: Press "OK" to save your settings. Now, when you type in Notepad, you will be using your chosen font.
